originalText: tch_rejectLeader
Start Element
rejectLeader
Goodbye.

::This humanoid creature turns its head to look at you with its dark, empty eyes. After some hesitation, it slowly approaches you and inspects you from top to bottom. Tentacles which grow on its head move independently from each other, like worms emerging from a handful of dirt, and act fully independent of the creature's other motions. 

Speaking of motions, the creature stops making any, instead turning nearly frozen yet still maintaining the amazed stare.::
::It cautiously observes you.::
::Its dark eyes are watching you.::
context.npc_tch_rejectLeader_startedRunning
context.npc_tch_rejectLeader_met
Can you speak?
::Leave it be.::

::Response comes in a form of a wet, gurgly voice.::

Yes.
::[Persuasion]:: Look, this place is very bad for you and you must leave. Please trust me - anywhere is better than here.

Look, this place is very bad for you and you must leave. Please trust me - anywhere is better than here. I've got someone waiting for you outside, a rogue Keeper. Don't be scared, he's like me, he wants to help you.
There is a large hole in one of the floors that leads to freedom. It is approximately to the west from where you emerge from the ventilation shaft, but you will have to go around to the south first.

There is a ventilation shaft in a corner just down the corridor. You can use it to escape. Once you go through it you will find yourself in a dark place. It is dangerous, but if you escape from there you will be able to enjoy your freedom.
Get out of here, I opened the cell doors!
Do you have a name?
::The creature is still, excluding the independent tentacles on its head and occasional blinking. However, it makes its decision quickly.::
You haven't hurt us *yet,* and despite me being... afraid, I will trust you. But how will we get out? Is there a way?
I understand. I hope we are doing the right thing.
How will we escape?
Where would we go? Swifty tried to run away when the Keepers came for him... and they ended him for that.

We were always like this, since the day we began. It's what we are. And we are locked because... ::It pauses.:: The Keepers do not allow us to go anywhere. The Keepers tell us that we will get ourselves hurt... or hurt others, that we are not yet ready to leave.
Name? ::He stops to think before responding.:: What is your name?
I don't know what you mean.
Yes. I have seen more siblings before, but sometimes only for a short time, then never again.
::The creature raises its malformed hand and waves you goodbye.::

::It makes a brief pause.::

I am me.
I am afraid. We get hurt here, but we know when and know how. Somewhere else though... ::He pauses.:: Thank you, but we stay here.
Thank you and... goodbye. Say goodbye to the Keepers for us.
But I don't like it here. The Keepers sometimes hurt us... or end some of us. Not all of them; some treat us well, but most do not.
They are either ended or moved.
Thank you. I hope the Keepers don't return before you do.
::[Stealth]:: Goodbye. I'll sneak you to the vent one by one, then you're on your own. You first...
Goodbye and good luck.
We will.
We will try to find it. You have already helped us more than enough.

We have nowhere to go; our whole lives we lived here with the Keepers, and we don't know what "somewhere else" is like. How will we feed? Where will we sleep? Is it too cold? Too hot? Are others who live there just like the Keepers? Or like you?

I have been called many names so far: Reject, Bastard, Freak, Inbred... but I don't like any of those. The tone they were said in sounded harsh. One Keeper once said I was, "pretty sharp for a Reject," so my siblings started calling me... Sharp.
I don't know how long a "year" lasts; I have heard the word. But if it means something to you, I am the oldest one of us here.

::The creature thinks about your question; the tentacles still move and twist around on its head, symbolizing its thought process in a peculiar way.::

*Human*? We were never called *human* before. The Keepers often call us... *Rejects*. Is that the answer you were looking for?
Tch_RejectsStealthEscape

They mostly keep us in these spaces. ::It points to the cell it is in.:: Once between two rests we are fed, led to walk and run, and every three or four rests they bring us to a bigger space and take bits of us and make us do "tests." We must obey, or else we are punished.
Alright.
I like that a lot more.
::It doesn't wait for your answer before proceeding.::

::It is this moment when you first notice something in its pitch-black eyes, and that something is fear.::

I don't want to be here. I don't want to be anywhere else. I... don't know what is best for me, or for us. And my siblings... they are like me.
Some siblings are led away by the Keepers to be ended, but new siblings always come. Always.

To me it seems long... but I don't know how that compares to you. I just thought of something... siblings and I do not age the same as the Keepers. We change faster than them; I noticed it on the Keepers with real faces.
Questions?
You look like a Keeper, but you don't act like a Keeper
You are not like the Keepers
- you are different. What will you do to me?
I think we mean the same.
::It pauses to think.:: Real like... theirs... uncovered. That is what I mean.
tchnob
I mean you no harm.
I am here to remove the burden of life from you. ::Attack!::
Then... why are you here? And where are the Keepers?
I don't understand. Why are you here?
